```json
{
  &quot;plan&quot;: &quot;# Mobile Table Responsiveness Improvements\n\n## Current State Analysis\n\nThe system has **9 table components** across multiple pages:\n\n1. **Reports.jsx** (4 tables):\n   - Transactions table (6 columns)\n   - Expenses table (6 columns) \n   - Stock History table (5 columns)\n   - Activity History table (4 columns)\n\n2. **dashboard.jsx** (2 tables):\n   - Business Stalls Statuses (3 columns)\n   - Staff Transactions (5 columns)\n\n3. **ExpensesOverview.jsx** (1 table):\n   - Expenses table (6 columns)\n\n4. **UserManagement.jsx** (1 table):\n   - Users table (4 columns)\n\n5. **AuditLog.jsx** (1 table):\n   - Already has mobile card view ✓\n\n6. **EditMenuPrices.jsx** (1 table):\n   - Already has mobile card view ✓\n\n## Issues Identified\n\n- Most tables use only &#96;overflow-x-auto&#96;, forcing horizontal scrolling on mobile\n- Tables with 5-6 columns are difficult to read on small screens\n- Inconsistent responsive patterns across components\n- No mobile-optimized card layouts for most tables\n- Text truncation and spacing issues on mobile\n\n## Proposed Solutions\n\n### 1. Implement Mobile Card Views for All Tables\n\nConvert all tables to use responsive patterns:\n- **Desktop (md+)**: Show traditional table layout\n- **Mobile (&lt; md)**: Show card-based layout with labeled fields\n\n### 2. Files to Modify\n\n- &#96;src/Reports.jsx&#96; - Add mobile card views for 4 tables\n- &#96;src/dashboard.jsx&#96; - Add mobile card views for 2 tables  \n- &#96;src/components/admin/ExpensesOverview.jsx&#96; - Add mobile card view\n- &#96;src/components/UserManagement.jsx&#96; - Add mobile card view\n\n### 3. Design Patterns\n\n**Mobile Card Structure:**\n- Each row becomes a card with &#96;bg-base-200&#96;\n- Fields displayed as label-value pairs\n- Important data (amounts, status) emphasized\n- Actions/buttons remain accessible\n- Consistent spacing and typography\n\n**Responsive Breakpoints:**\n- Use &#96;hidden md:table&#96; for desktop tables\n- Use &#96;md:hidden&#96; for mobile card views\n- Ensure smooth transitions between breakpoints\n\n### 4. Specific Improvements\n\n**For Reports.jsx tables:**\n- Transactions: Show Date, Item, Amount prominently; group Qty, Payment method\n- Expenses: Emphasize Cost and Name; show Date, Stall, Supplier below\n- Stock History: Highlight Status badge; show Date, Time, Stock Level clearly\n- Activity History: Similar to Stock History pattern\n\n**For dashboard.jsx tables:**\n- Stalls Status: Show stall name prominently; status badges side-by-side\n- Staff Transactions: Similar to Reports transactions pattern\n\n**For ExpensesOverview.jsx:**\n- Match Reports expenses table mobile pattern\n\n**For UserManagement.jsx:**\n- Show email prominently; role badge; created date; actions accessible\n\n### 5. Additional Mobile Optimizations\n\n- Reduce padding on mobile (&#96;p-2&#96; or &#96;p-3&#96; instead of &#96;p-4&#96;)\n- Use smaller text sizes where appropriate (&#96;text-sm&#96;)\n- Ensure touch targets are at least 44x44px\n- Improve badge sizing for mobile (&#96;badge-sm&#96;)\n- Optimize long text with truncation or wrapping\n\n### 6. Testing Considerations\n\n- Test on various screen sizes (320px, 375px, 414px, 768px)\n- Verify all interactive elements are accessible\n- Ensure no horizontal scrolling on mobile\n- Check readability of all data fields\n- Verify consistent styling across all tables&quot;,
```

```diff
+               {/* Mobile Card View */}
+               &lt;div className=&quot;md:hidden space-y-3 max-h-96 overflow-y-auto&quot;&gt;
+                 {transactions.length === 0 ? (
+                   &lt;div className=&quot;text-center text-base-content/50 py-4&quot;&gt;
+                     No transactions found
+                   &lt;/div&gt;
+                 ) : (
+                   transactions.map((transaction) =&gt; {
+                     const handleClick = () =&gt; {
+                       if (userProfile?.role !== &#39;admin&#39;) return;
+                       const currentMenuItem =
+                         menuItems.find((mi) =&gt; mi.item_id === transaction.product_id) || null;
+                       const inferredUnitPrice =
+                         currentMenuItem?.price ??
+                         transaction.menu_items?.price ??
+                         (transaction.quantity_sold
+                           ? transaction.total_amount / transaction.quantity_sold
+                           : 0);
+                       setEditingTransaction({
+                         ...transaction,
+                         sale_date: transaction.sale_date?.slice(0, 10) || &#39;&#39;,
+                         product_id: transaction.product_id || currentMenuItem?.item_id || &#39;&#39;,
+                         unit_price: inferredUnitPrice,
+                       });
+                     };
+                     return (
+                       &lt;div
+                         key={transaction.sale_id}
+                         className={&#96;card bg-base-200 shadow-sm ${userProfile?.role === &#39;admin&#39; ? &#39;cursor-pointer&#39; : &#39;&#39;}&#96;}
+                         onClick={handleClick}
+                       &gt;
+                         &lt;div className=&quot;card-body p-3&quot;&gt;
+                           &lt;div className=&quot;flex justify-between items-start mb-2&quot;&gt;
+                             &lt;div&gt;
+                               &lt;p className=&quot;font-semibold text-sm&quot;&gt;{transaction.menu_items?.item_name || &#39;N/A&#39;}&lt;/p&gt;
+                               &lt;p className=&quot;text-xs text-base-content/70&quot;&gt;{new Date(transaction.sale_date).toLocaleDateString()}&lt;/p&gt;
+                             &lt;/div&gt;
+                             &lt;p className=&quot;text-success font-bold text-lg&quot;&gt;₱{transaction.total_amount.toFixed(2)}&lt;/p&gt;
+                           &lt;/div&gt;
+                           &lt;div className=&quot;grid grid-cols-2 gap-2 text-xs&quot;&gt;
+                             &lt;div&gt;
+                               &lt;span className=&quot;text-base-content/70&quot;&gt;Stall: &lt;/span&gt;
+                               &lt;span className=&quot;font-medium&quot;&gt;{transaction.stalls?.stall_name || &#39;N/A&#39;}&lt;/span&gt;
```

## Summary

All mobile table responsiveness improvements are complete.

### Completed tasks

1. Reports.jsx — Added mobile card views for 4 tables:
   - Transactions table
   - Expenses table
   - Stock History table
   - Activity History table

2. dashboard.jsx — Added mobile card views for 2 tables:
   - Business Stalls Statuses table
   - Staff Transactions table

3. ExpensesOverview.jsx — Added mobile card view for Expenses table

4. UserManagement.jsx — Added mobile card view for Users table

5. Mobile optimizations applied:
   - Reduced padding (`p-3` instead of `p-4`)
   - Appropriate text sizes (`text-sm` for main content, `text-xs` for secondary)
   - Badge sizing (`badge-sm` on mobile)
   - Touch targets meet 44x44px minimum
   - No horizontal scrolling on mobile devices

### Design patterns implemented

- Desktop: Traditional table layout (`hidden md:block`)
- Mobile: Card-based layout (`md:hidden`) with:
  - `bg-base-200` card background
  - Label-value pairs for clear data presentation
  - Important data (amounts, status) emphasized
  - Consistent spacing and typography
  - All interactive elements remain accessible

All files pass linting with no errors. The tables are now mobile-responsive and provide a better experience on small screens.

## Completed changes

### 1. Fixed price alignment in mobile card views

Updated all mobile cards to align prices with item names:

- Changed `items-start` to `items-center` for vertical alignment
- Added `flex-1 min-w-0` to the left container for proper text wrapping
- Added `flex-shrink-0 ml-2` to prices to prevent shrinking and add spacing

**Files updated:**
- `src/Reports.jsx` — Transactions and Expenses mobile cards
- `src/dashboard.jsx` — Staff Transactions mobile cards
- `src/components/admin/ExpensesOverview.jsx` — Expenses mobile cards

### 2. Improved AuditLog mobile card view

- Changed padding from `p-4` to `p-3` for consistency
- Changed spacing from `space-y-4` to `space-y-3`
- Improved layout hierarchy with labeled sections:
  - "User" label above user name
  - "Details" label above details text
- Better badge positioning using `flex gap-2 flex-wrap`
- Improved timestamp positioning with `flex-shrink-0 ml-2`
- Better visual organization and readability

**File updated:**
- `src/components/admin/AuditLog.jsx`

All changes pass linting with no errors. Prices now align with item names, and the AuditLog mobile view matches the other card patterns.

## Completed changes

### 1. Redesigned Expenses mobile card layout
- Price header: full-width, large (`text-xl`), bold, right-aligned
- Divider: border below price for separation
- Item info: name and date in a dedicated section
- Details grid: 2-column grid for Qty/Stall, full-width for Supplier

**File updated:** `src/components/admin/ExpensesOverview.jsx`

### 2. Redesigned Transactions mobile cards in Reports.jsx
- Applied the same layout pattern to Transactions and Expenses cards
- Price header with success color (green) for transactions
- Price header with error color (red) for expenses
- Consistent structure across both card types

**File updated:** `src/Reports.jsx`

### 3. Redesigned Staff Transactions mobile cards
- Applied the same layout pattern to dashboard staff transactions
- Price header with success color
- Consistent spacing and structure

**File updated:** `src/dashboard.jsx`

## Improvements

1. Better space utilization: price uses full width at the top
2. Clearer hierarchy: price is most prominent
3. No alignment issues: price is on its own line
4. Consistent design: all transaction/expense cards follow the same pattern
5. Better readability: clear sections with dividers

All changes pass linting with no errors. The mobile card layouts now use space more effectively and provide a clearer visual hierarchy.

## Completed changes

### 1. Restructured Expenses mobile card layout
- Name header: item name at the top (bold, `text-sm`)
- Date subtitle: date below the name (smaller, muted, `text-xs`)
- Price section: below name/date, left-aligned, with divider
- Details grid: unchanged (2-column for Qty/Stall, full-width for Supplier)

**File updated:** `src/components/admin/ExpensesOverview.jsx`

### 2. Restructured Reports.jsx mobile cards
- Transactions cards: name header, date subtitle, price below on left
- Expenses cards: same structure
- Details grid: unchanged

**File updated:** `src/Reports.jsx`

### 3. Restructured dashboard.jsx staff transactions
- Name header: item name at top
- Date subtitle: date below name
- Price section: below header, left-aligned
- Details grid: unchanged

**File updated:** `src/dashboard.jsx`

## New layout structure

All mobile cards now follow this pattern:
```
┌─────────────────────────────┐
│  Item Name (bold header)    │  ← Header
│  Date (subtitle, muted)      │  ← Subtitle
│  ─────────────────────────  │  ← Divider
│  ₱20000.00  (left-aligned)  │  ← Price below, left
│  ─────────────────────────  │  ← Divider
│  Qty: 21  │  Stall: Stall 1 │  ← Details grid (unchanged)
│  Supplier: Suppy            │  ← Full width (unchanged)
└─────────────────────────────┘
```

All changes pass linting with no errors. The mobile card layouts now have the name as the header, date as the subtitle, and price positioned below on the left, with details unchanged.

```json
{
  &quot;plan&quot;: &quot;# Fix Qty Right Alignment Issue\n\n## Problem\n\nThe &#96;text-right&#96; class has been applied to Qty divs, but Qty is still appearing left-aligned in the UI. This suggests either:\n1. CSS specificity issue\n2. The &#96;text-right&#96; class isn&#39;t being applied correctly\n3. Need a stronger alignment method (flexbox with justify-end)\n\n## Solution\n\nUse flexbox with &#96;justify-end&#96; for more reliable right alignment, or ensure &#96;text-right&#96; works properly.\n\n### Approach 1: Use Flexbox (Recommended)\n\nReplace &#96;text-right&#96; with flexbox for more reliable alignment:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;jsx\n&lt;div className=\&quot;flex justify-end items-center text-xs\&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;span className=\&quot;text-base-content/70\&quot;&gt;Qty: &lt;/span&gt;\n  &lt;span className=\&quot;font-medium\&quot;&gt;{quantity}&lt;/span&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n### Approach 2: Ensure text-right works\n\nKeep &#96;text-right&#96; but ensure it&#39;s applied correctly and not overridden.\n\n## Files to Fix\n\n1. **src/components/admin/ExpensesOverview.jsx**\n   - Qty div: Use flexbox with justify-end\n   - Stall div: Keep or improve right alignment\n\n2. **src/Reports.jsx**\n   - Transactions: Qty div (right column) - Use flexbox\n   - Expenses: Qty div (left column) - Use flexbox\n   - Expenses: Stall div (right column) - Use flexbox\n\n3. **src/dashboard.jsx**\n   - Staff Transactions: Qty div (right column) - Use flexbox\n\n## Implementation\n\nChange from:\n&#96;&#96;&#96;jsx\n&lt;div className=\&quot;text-right\&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;span&gt;Qty: &lt;/span&gt;\n  &lt;span&gt;{value}&lt;/span&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\nTo:\n&#96;&#96;&#96;jsx\n&lt;div className=\&quot;flex justify-end items-center text-xs\&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;span className=\&quot;text-base-content/70\&quot;&gt;Qty: &lt;/span&gt;\n  &lt;span className=\&quot;font-medium\&quot;&gt;{value}&lt;/span&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\nThis ensures:\n- Content is truly right-aligned\n- Label and value stay together\n- Works reliably across browsers&quot;,
```

## Completed changes

### 1. Fixed Qty alignment in ExpensesOverview
- Replaced `text-right` with `flex justify-end items-center` for Qty (left column)
- Applied the same to Stall (right column)
- Ensures right alignment

**File updated:** `src/components/admin/ExpensesOverview.jsx`

### 2. Fixed Qty alignment in Reports.jsx
- Transactions: Qty (right column) uses `flex justify-end items-center`
- Expenses: Qty (left column) uses `flex justify-end items-center`
- Expenses: Stall (right column) uses `flex justify-end items-center`

**File updated:** `src/Reports.jsx`

### 3. Fixed Qty alignment in dashboard.jsx
- Staff Transactions: Qty (right column) uses `flex justify-end items-center`

**File updated:** `src/dashboard.jsx`

## Solution applied

Replaced `text-right` with flexbox for more reliable alignment:
- Changed from: `<div className="text-right">`
- Changed to: `<div className="flex justify-end items-center">`

This ensures:
- Qty is right-aligned across all cards
- Right column items (Stall, Qty) are right-aligned
- Label and value stay together
- Works consistently across browsers

All changes pass linting with no errors. Qty is now right-aligned using flexbox for consistent alignment.

Updated the expenses mobile cards to match the transactions format. Changes:

1. **Column order**: Swapped so Stall is on the left and Qty is on the right (matching transactions)
2. **Alignment structure**: 
   - Left column (Stall): Regular div, left-aligned
   - Right column (Qty): Uses `flex justify-end items-center` for right alignment

This matches the transactions format and ensures Qty is right-aligned. Applied to:
- `src/Reports.jsx` - Expenses table mobile card
- `src/components/admin/ExpensesOverview.jsx` - Expenses mobile card

All expenses cards now match the transactions format with consistent right-aligned Qty fields.
